Module identifiers.py¶

modules.identifiers.sequence_identifier(path_input, chromosome_ID, main_folder_path, genome_fasta, naming_short, max_diff)¶

Main program, which calls the iterative blaster and all the filters needed.

Parameters

  • path_input (string) – Path to the main CSV file where data will be filtered. Initially is a CSV file wich was output from blastn_blaster() alone to obtain the initial data.

  • chromosome_ID (member of a python list) – Chromosome identifier, e.g., LinJ.07, which were present more then once in the path_input. See repetitive_blaster() for more information.

  • main_folder_path (string) – Path where the results will be placed.

  • genome_fasta (string) – Path to our whole genome sequence in FASTA format.

  • naming_short (string) – Label needed to read the ID of each cromosome in the .csv file. In the case of L. infantum for example, would be LinJ since the .csv file IDs are LinJ.XX.

  • max_diff (integer) – Maximun proxomity value for the different sequences when they have to be grouped. Important.

Returns

A CSV file with all the data filtered

Return type

CSV file

modules.identifiers.specific_sequence_extractor(path_input, chromosome_ID, main_folder_path)¶

First it reads a CSV file and takes the rows which include in the second column (the one with the chromosome IDs), the defined chromosome. Then, it creates a .csv file with all the selectes rows in a subfolder in a specified directory using folder_creator() and csv_creator().

Example of use

If chromosome_ID = LinJ.02, it will take all rows in the .csv where the second column contains LinJ.02

Parameters

  • path_input (string) – Path to the main CSV file where data will be filtered. Initially is a CSV file wich was output from blastn_blaster() alone to obtain the initial data.

  • chromosome_ID (member of a python list) – Chromosome identifier, e.g., LinJ.07, which were present more then once in the path_input. See repetitive_blaster() for more information.

  • main_folder_path (string) – Path where the results will be placed. It will create a subfolder with the chromosome_ID name.

Returns

A CSV file with the selected “chromosome_ID” rows.

Return type

CSV file
